abstract: New York Times review finds nearly half of health plans offered on federal marketplace come with deductible of $3,000 or more, rate many Americans are describing as impossibly high; prohibitive deductibles have prompted many to drop their plans, belying expense Obama administration has elided amid focus on low premiums and subsidies.
lead_paragraph: For many consumers, the sticker shock is coming not on the front end, when they purchase Affordable Care Act plans, but when they get sick and are hit by sky-high deductibles.

headline.main: Many Say High Deductibles Make Their Health Law Insurance All but Useless
headline.print_headline: Many Say High Deductibles Make Their Health Law Insurance All but Useless

snippet: For many consumers, the sticker shock is coming not on the front end, when they purchase Affordable Care Act plans, but when they get sick and are hit by sky-high deductibles.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
